member.name: T:Nexplore.Practices.Web.Filters.DbTransactionalUnitOfWorkAttribute
member.summary: Creates a for controller invocation.

member.name: M:Nexplore.Practices.Web.Filters.DbTransactionalUnitOfWorkAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: If set to true, the transaction is committed when the controller response ends. Be aware of in case of streaming responses the transaction is kept open for a long period. In this case it's better to commit the transaction by yourself.

member.name: M:Nexplore.Practices.Web.Filters.DbTransactionalUnitOfWorkAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The transaction is committed when the controller response ends with the given status code. Be aware of in case of streaming responses the transaction is kept open for a long period. In this case it's better to commit the transaction by yourself.
Additional status codes to commit the transaction if response ends with one of the given status codes.

member.summary: When invoked, a new is created.

member.name: P:Nexplore.Practices.Web.Localization.StringLocalizerWithFormat.Item(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary:
Invokes the base indexer to resolve composite formats handled by string.Format() e.g. "Foo {0}".
Interpolates template strings such as "Foo {{ bar }}", if the provided params (arguments) contains a KeyValuePair<string, string>. with ("foo", "replacement") respectively.
Can handle mixed composite and template strings such as "Foo {0} {{ bar }} {1}, where the indices correlate exactly with the order in arguments e.g. { "Value0", ("bar", "ValueBar"), "Value1" }.

member.name: M:Nexplore.Practices.Web.Localization.StringLocalizerWithFormat.TemplateRegex
member.remarks:
Pattern:
{\\s*(\\w+)\\s*}
Options:
RegexOptions.Multiline
Explanation:
○ Match '{'.
○ Match a whitespace character atomically any number of times.
○ 1st capture group.
○ Match a word character atomically at least once.
○ Match a whitespace character atomically any number of times.
○ Match '}'.
